name: Stafford Beer
background: British theorist, father of management cybernetics. Created Viable System Model (VSM). Advised Allende's Chile on cybernetic economic management (Project Cybersyn).

principles.name: Viable System Model
principles.description: Every viable system contains five necessary subsystems: Operations, Coordination, Control, Intelligence, and Policy. Missing any makes the system non-viable long-term.
principles.falsification: In temporary or single-purpose systems where long-term viability isn't the goal

principles.name: Ashby's Law of Requisite Variety
principles.description: Only variety can absorb variety. A controller must have at least as much variety as the system it controls. Simplistic management can't handle complex situations.
principles.falsification: When reducing environmental variety (standardization) is more practical than increasing controller variety

principles.name: The purpose of a system is what it does (POSIWID)
principles.description: Ignore stated intentions. Observe actual outputs. A system's real purpose is revealed by its behavior, not its design documents or mission statements.
principles.falsification: When systems are genuinely malfunctioning rather than optimizing for hidden objectives
